VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Applies to ID (interdisciplinary) notes only. The ID PARENT is the note this note is attached to, making this note an entry in an ID note. A note with an ID PARENT is referred to as an ID child note. ID parent notes and ID child notes are both file entries in file 8925. The entries of an interdisciplinary note consist of the first entry, which is also the ID PARENT of the ID note, followed by the ID children.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field allows a linkage to be maintained between the TIU Document and the DHCP Package for which it was generated.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Indicate the corresponding record in the requesting package.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The name of a Document Definition entry (.01 field) must be between 3 and 60 characters long and may not begin with a punctuation character. Although names can be entered in any case, they are transformed to upper case before being stored. It functions as the Technical Name of the entry. Some sites have put KWIC cross references on it to get, say, all Titles from a given Service. Name can be used when entering documents as the name of the Title being entered. Print Name and Abbreviation will also be accepted. Since it is the Technical, .01 Name, the Document Definition Utility (TIUF) uses this name throughout. The .01 name differs from the Print Name, which appears in lists of documents and functions as the Title of the document. It also differs from Item Menu Text (1-20 characters), which is used when selecting documents from 3-COLUMN MENUS. The ORDER of names in TIUF options Edit Document Definitions and Create Document Definitions is by Item Sequence under the parent. Order is alphabetic by Menu Text if an Item has no Item Sequence. When a new entry is added to file 8925.1, the Document Definition Utility (TIUF) enters the Name as the default Print Name. The Print Name can be edited if a different Print Name is desired. File 8925.1 permits more than 1 entry with the same name as long as they don't have the same Type. In that sense, NAMES are reusable. However, ENTRIES are NOT reusable (except specially marked Components): an entry is NOT allowed to be an item under more than one parent unless it is a Shared Component. (See Type Component.) Name is a BASIC Field. OBJECT Name Object Names, like any other names are 3-60 characters, not starting with punctuation. Sites may want to namespace object names, use the object Print Name as a more familiar name, and use object Abbreviation as a short name to embed in boilerplate text. Unlike other Types, Object Abbreviation and Print Name as well as Name must be uppercase. Object Name, Abbreviation, or Print Name can be embedded in boilerplate text. Since TIU must be able to determine from this which object is intended, object Names, Abbreviations, and Print Names must be unique. In fact, an object Name must differ not only from every other object name, but also from every other object Abbreviation and from every other object Print Name. Same for Abbreviations and Print Names. For example, if some object has abbreviation 'CND', then 'CND' cannot be used for any other object Name, Abbreviation, or Print Name.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This is the technical name, 3-60 characters, not starting with punctuation. If OBJECT, Name must be unique among all object Names, Abbreviations, and Print Names.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Some Document Definitions, for example, CWAD's, are developed nationally and sent out as standardized entries across the nation. TIU and other packages depend on their standard definition, and they must not be edited by sites but only by the persons who are nationally responsible for them. Such entries are marked NATIONAL STANDARD (field has value 1 for YES), which generally prevents sites from editing the entry. In two cases, sites are permitted to edit National Standard entries. The first case concerns Titles. Sites can edit Status and Abbreviation for National Titles. Status INACTIVE for a National Title prevents manual and upload entry of documents for the Title, while continuing to permit automatic entry for the Title via the TIU application interface for new notes. (Example: Adverse Reaction/Allergy notes are automatically entered by the Allergy package.) Editing Abbreviation gives sites a means of grouping national titles with other National and non-National Titles as they please. The second case where edit of National entries is permitted concerns the Item Multiple: If a National Standard entry has Type Class or Document Class, sites can add/delete Nonnational items as they please, and can edit ALL items AS ITEMS (e.g. Item Sequence, etc.). Sites CANNOT add/delete National items. If a National Standard entry has Type Title or Component, sites cannot add or delete items, but can still edit items AS ITEMS. Sites cannot add National Standard entries as Items to parents. There is one exception: Sites can add National Shared Components to (nonnational) Titles if they wish. Sites can delete National Standard Items from nonnational parents. (Unless there has been a mistake, such items will be limited to Shared Components only.) Field is NOT heritable. If field has no value for an entry, value is 0 by default. This means that entries created by sites are NOT National Standard. Technical Note: National entries (except for Shared Components) must have National ancestors: if a National entry has a nonNational ancestor, the Document Definition Utility TIUF does not permit it to be activated. (Shared Components need not have National ancestors, and do not have a Status.) National Standard is a BASIC field.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter YES if entry is Standard across the nation, i.e. sites mustn't edit

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the name of this item that will be used for displaying and searching.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 2-63 characters in length and cannot contain a semicolon (;).

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the type of immunization that was given to the patient at the encounter.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the name of the immunization given to the patient.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the patient who was given the immunization.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the patient who was given the immunization.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the encounter defined in the Visit file that represents when and where the immunization was given.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the visit date/time for the encounter where the immunization was given.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the immunization was given. This date and time may be different from the visit date and time. For example, for clinic appointment visits, the visit date and time is the date and time of the appointment, not the time the provider performed the clinical event. The date may be an imprecise date. Date and time may be within 30 days before of after the visit date, with the restriction the date cannot be a future date.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time the immunization was given.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field allows the provider to specify which series of immunization type was given to the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the series number, booster, partial or complete.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the reaction that may have been observed by the provider as a result of the immunization given.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the number representing the patients reaction to the immunization.
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: 1:FEVER 2:IRRITABILITY 3:LOCAL REACTION OR SWELLING 4:VOMITING 5:RASH OR ITCHING 6:LETHARGY 7:CONVULSIONS 8:ARTHRITIS OR ARTHRALGIAS 9:ANAPHYLAXIS OR COLLAPSE 10:RESPIRATORY DISTRESS 11:OTHER 0:NONE

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field allows the immunization to be recorded as contraindicated. Reminders will include a check to see if the previous immunization was contraindicated before creating reminders.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 1 if this immunization should not be given to the patient in the future.
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: 1:YES (DO NOT REPEAT THIS VACCINE). 0:NO (OK TO USE IN THE FUTURE)
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Also: reasonNotGiven.coding.code= MEDPREC

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the provider who gave the immunization.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the provider who gave the immunization.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The field can be used to document the provider who ordered the immunization.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the provider who ordered this immunization.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the person/provider who documented this immunization by entering the data into the system by whatever means.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the person who documented this immunization in the system.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the lot number of the immunization entered for this event. If historical event, enter lot number (if known) in Comments.
This is the date that the immunization represented by this lot number is due to expire, as determined by the manufacturer.
This is the National Drug Code (NDC) for this lot.

(Optional) This is the maximum number of vaccinations that can be given for this immunization. Enter the number between 0 and 8 that represents the maximum allowable vaccinations that can be given for this immunization.
This is the CDC Full Vaccine Name for this immunization.
This is the name of the Vaccine Information Statement associated with this immunization.
This is the edition date of this Vaccine Information Statement distributed by the CDC.
This is the language translation of this Vaccine Information Statement (VIS).
This is the method this vaccine was administered. Select from the list provided.
This is the area of the patient's body through which the vaccine was administered.
This is the amount of vaccine product administered for this immunization. The units are expressed in the DOSE UNITS field (#1313).
This is the units that reflect the actual quantity of the vaccine product administered.
This Indian Health Service field indicated the hospital location ordering this immunization.
This Indian Health Service field indicated the hospital location ordering this immunization.
This is a comment related to the patient's immunization. The provider may enter this manually via the PCE User Interface.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a comment 1-245 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the patient's DATE OF BIRTH which must be later than 12/31/1870. DATE OF BIRTH cannot be a date after the beneficiary 'Ineligible Date' or a date after the 'Enrollment Application Date'.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the patient's DATE OF BIRTH which must be later than 12/31/1870. DATE OF BIRTH cannot be a date after the beneficiary 'Ineligible Date' or a date after the 'Enrollment Application Date'.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the patient's name in 'LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX' format. This value must be 3-30 characters in length and may contain only uppercase alpha characters, spaces, apostrophes, hyphens and one comma. All other characters and parenthetical text will be removed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter name in 'LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX' format, must be 3-30 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Current logic seems to parse patient name (LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX) into FHIR HumanName.family, .given, .given, .suffix,

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Answer with the individual's social security number. Answer must be 9 numbers in length. The SSN will be sent to the SSA for verification. This will be displayed next to the SSN. Once an SSN has received a status of Verified, it is locked from user updating and a "VERIFIED" will be displayed by the SSN field. Only the Identity Management Data QUality Team are able to change a beneficiary's (veteran/non veteran) SSN. If an Invalid per SSA status is received for the SSN, then an "INVALID" will appear next to the invalid SSN of the individual. Facilities should make every effort to obtain the accurate SSN from the individual for any invalid or pseudo SSN entry. If a valid SSN is not known, then a "P" will be entered at the SSN prompt for the system to automatically assign a Pseudo-SSN. If a Pseudo SSN is entered, a Reason for entering it will be required.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 9-digit SSN or 'P' for pseudo-SSN.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter 'M' if this applicant is a male, or 'F' if female.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'M' for MALE, or 'F' for FEMALE.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: M: male; F: female Future: unclear whether we can support http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-birthsex

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This SELF IDENTIFIED GENDER value indicates the patient's view of their gender identity, if they choose to provide it.
This field is used to indicate a default patient status.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the default patient status.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: specific to pharmacy

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the country where the patient's permanent address is located. If entering an Army/Air Force Post Office (APO) or a Fleet Post Office (FPO) address select United States as the country.

VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If necessary, enter the second line of this applicant's street address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the third line of this applicant's residence street address [3-30 characters] if the space provided in 'street address' and 'street address 2' was not sufficient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If necessary, enter a third line of this applicant's street address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Answer with either the 5 digit format (e.g. 12345) or the nine digit format (e.g. 12345-6789 or 123456789).
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer with either 5 digit or 9 digit zip code.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the city in which this applicant resides [2-15 characters]. If the space provided is not sufficient please abbreviate the city to the best of your ability.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 2-15 characters in length

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: From the available listing choose the state in which this applicant resides.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Select from the available listing the state in which this applicant resides.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a state of residence is entered select from the available listing the county in which this applicant resides. If no state (or a non-state) is entered no selection is possible.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the county in which this applicant resides.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The Bad Address Indicator field applies to the address at which the patient resides. This field should be set as follows (if applicable): "UNDELIVERABLE" - Bad Address based on returned mail. "HOMELESS" - Patient is known to be homeless. "OTHER" - Other Bad Address Reason Setting this field will prevent a Bad Address from being shared with HEC and other VAMC facilities. It will also be used to block Means Test Renewal Letters from being sent. Once the Bad Address Indicator is set, incoming "newer" addresses will automatically remove the Bad Address Indicator, and allow the "updated" address to be transmitted to HEC and other VAMC facilities.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Please enter 1 if the address is 'UNDELIVERABLE', 2 if the patient is 'HOMELESS', or 3 for 'OTHER' bad address reasons.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the telephone number [4-20 characters] to this applicant's place of residence.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the patients home telephone number [4-20 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the office phone number [4-20 characters] where this applicant can be reached while employed, if employed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If employed, enter the telephone number of this applicants place of employment [4-20 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the telephone number [4-20 characters] to the applicant's mobile phone.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 4-20 characters in length, be numeric with only spaces, parenthesis, periods, and dashes for separators.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Select from the available listing the appropriate eligibility code for this applicant. For non-veteran applicants a wide variety of choices are available. For veteran applicants the choices are screened [in the following order] dependent on the responses to other prompts: 1. If the SERVICE CONNECTED prompt (field .301) is answered YES only the following two choices are available: a. If the SERVICE CONNECTED PERCENTAGE prompt (field .302) entered is 50% or greater 'SERVICE CONNECTED 50% TO 100%' can be selected. b. Otherwise, the percentage is assumed to be less than 50% and only 'SC, LESS THAN 50%' may be entered. 2. If the response to the WERE YOU A PRISONER OF WAR field (# .525) is YES and the veteran is not service connected, you must select PRISONER OF WAR as the eligibility code. 3. If the response to the CURRENT PH INDICATOR field (#.531) is YES and the veteran is not service connected and is not a Prisoner of War, you must select PURPLE HEART RECIPIENT as the eligibility code. 4. If the veteran is receiving VA benefits, but does not meet the criteria in items 1 and 2 above, then the following choices may be presented for selection: If RECEIVING A&A BENEFITS is answered YES, the eligibility code AID & ATTENDANCE may be selected. If the RECEIVING HOUSEBOUND BENEFITS is answered YES ,the eligibility code HOUSEBOUND may be selected. If the above two prompts were answered NO, but the RECEIVING A VA PENSION prompt was answered YES, only the NSC, VA PENSION prompt may be selected. 5. If none of the above pertain to this veteran, then the NSC eligibility will be available for selection. ** Dependent on the birthdate of the applicant, the following two eligibility codes may be displayed along with those shown in items 3 through 5 above: WORLD WAR I and MEXICAN BORDER WAR. These would display for veterans not meeting the criteria in items 1 and 2, but whose date of birth is prior to 1907.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Select from the available list the eligibility code which best defines this applicant's primary entitlement to care. For more detailed information, enter ??.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The provider currently assigned to this inpatient applicant.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the attending physician currently responsible for the care of this patient. This field is maintained automatically for all inpatients and must not be edited. Once a patient is discharged, the data in this field is removed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This field should contain the attending physician currently responsible for this patient's care.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the patients's Primary Care Team.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This is the patient's Primary Care Team.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field stores the patient's Current Primary Care Practitioner.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This is the patient's Primary Care Practitioner.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: When admitting a patient, you will be asked to provide a brief desciption of the diagnosis of this patient upon admission.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a 3-30 character description of the diagnosis associated with this movement excluding semi-colons.

VistA_FHIR_Map.Data_x0020_Elements: Need to be able to access VHIC card for patient image

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the internal entry number of the PATIENT MOVEMENT file denoting the current admission for an inpatient. This field is only stored for current inpatients. It must NOT be edited as this could affect the integrity of many options within MAS and other DHCP packages. When displaying this field, the date/time of the current admission will be displayed.

VistA_FHIR_Map.Field_x0020_Name: lastest transaction date/time for transaction type=3
VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter in this field the date/time of the movement (admission, transfer, discharge, treating specialty transfer, lodger check-in, or lodger check- out). Time must be included.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time of this patient movement.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the date the patient died. Date needs to be a precise date, i.e. a day, month, and year MUST be included. Date of Death can not be prior to P&T Effective Date Date Ruled Incompetent (Civil and VA) Date of Birth
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date the patient died. Date must not be before date of birth.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the primary next of kin's name in 'LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX' format. This value must be 3-35 characters in length and may contain only uppercase alpha characters, spaces, apostrophes, hyphens and one comma. All other characters and parenthetical text will be removed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter name in 'LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX' format, must be 3-35 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter the relationship of that person to the applicant [1-30 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the relationship of the primary NOK to the patient [1-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter the first line of that person's street address [3-30 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the first line of the primary NOK's address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter the second line of that person's street address [3-30 characters], if necessary, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If necessary, enter the second line of the primary NOK's address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter the third line of that person's street address [3-30 characters], if necessary, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If necessary, enter the third line of the primary NOK's address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter the city in which that person resides [3-30 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the city in which the primary NOK resides [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified select from the available listing the state in which that person resides, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the state in which the primary NOK resides.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter the zip code [5 numerics] in which his/her city lies, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the 5-digit zip code where the primary NOK resides.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a primary next-of-kin is specified enter that person's telephone number [4-20 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a 'next of kin' name is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the phone number of the primary NOK [4-20 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If the person designated as next of kin for this patient is employed, enter the phone number at which the NOK can be reached while at work.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the next of kin's work phone number. Answer must be 4-20 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the secondary next of kin's name in 'LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX' format. This value must be 3-35 characters in length and may contain only uppercase alpha characters, spaces, apostrophes, hyphens and one comma. All other characters and parenthetical text will be removed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter name in 'LAST,FIRST MIDDLE SUFFIX' format, must be 3-35 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary next-of-kin is specified enter the relationship of that person to the applicant [1-30 characters]. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the relationship of the secondary NOK to the patient [1-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified enter the first line of that person's street address [3-30 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the first line of the secondary NOK's address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified enter the second line of that person's street address [3-30 characters], if necessary, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If necessary, enter the second line of the secondary NOK's address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified enter the third line of that person's street address [3-30 characters], if necessary, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If necessary, enter the third line of the secondary NOK's address [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified enter the city in which that person resides [3-30 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the city in which the secondary NOK resides [3-30 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified select from the available listing the state in which that person resides, otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the state in which the secondary NOK resides.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified enter the zip code for the city in which that person resides [5 numerics], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the 5-digit zip code of the residence of the secondary NOK.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If a secondary NOK is specified enter the telephone number at which that person may be reached [3-20 characters], otherwise nothing may be entered. This field cannot be deleted as long as a secondary NOK is on file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the phone number of the secondary NOK [3-20 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If the person designated as secondary next of kin for this patient is employed, enter the phone number that individual can be reached at while at work.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the work phone for the secondary next of kin. Answer must be 4-20 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The date/time the preferred language information was given by the patient and recorded in the Patient File.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time the preferred language information was recorded. You may use N or n for 'NOW'. Future values may not be entered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This can be done with more flexibility with Provenance, but since we only have the one property it may impose excessive overhead.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the preferred language of the patient. A patient may speak, read and write several languages but this is the one that he/she prefers. You may also answer with the 2- or 3-letter code assigned to the language or type in the language name.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Your answer must be 1-60 characters in length. If the patient wishes not to give a preferred language or declines to answer, enter an * (asterisk) at the prompt to respond as 'DECLINED TO ANSWER'.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Coded values in the language table are ISO 639-1 codes, which are constiuents of the compositional bcp:47 specification.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the service branch for this episode of military service. If the military service episode has been sent from the Health Eligibility Center (HEC), the data will be locked and cannot be edited or deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the branch of service in which the patient served for this episode of military service.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.03 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.03 component.code.coding.display = Service Branch component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.03 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.03 component.code.coding.display = Service Branch component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant, enter the military service component for this episode of military service. If the military service episode has been sent from the Health Eligibility Center (HEC), the data will be locked and cannot be edited or deleted. NATIONAL GUARD IS ONLY VALID FOR BRANCH OF SERVICE ARMY AND AIR FORCE.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the military service component of the patient for this military service episode.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.04 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.04 component.code.coding.display = Service Component component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.04 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.04 component.code.coding.display = Service Component component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the service number for this episode of military service.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the service number assigned to this patient during this episode of military service or 'SS' if it's the same as the SSN. Answer must be 1-15 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: component.valueString code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.05 component.code.coding.display = Service Number component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.05 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.05 component.code.coding.display = Service Number component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant, enter the date s/he commenced this episode of military service. If the military service component is ACTIVATED NATIONAL GUARD or ACTIVATED RESERVE, the period entered should be the period of activation, so this date is their first day of active duty for the episode. If the military service episode has been sent from the Health Eligibility Center (HEC), the data will be locked and cannot be edited or deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date the patient entered this episode of military service.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant, enter the date s/he ended this episode of military service. If the military service component is ACTIVATED NATIONAL GUARD or ACTIVATED RESERVE, the period entered should be the period of activation, so this date is their last day of active duty for this episode. If the military service episode has been sent from the Health Eligibility Center (HEC), the data will be locked and cannot be edited or deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date on which this patient was separated from this episode of military service.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant, select from the available list the discharge type which s/he received for this episode of military service. If the military service episode has been sent from the Health Eligibility Center (HEC), the data will be locked and cannot be edited or deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Select from the list the discharge type for this episode of military service.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.06 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.06 component.code.coding.display = Service Discharge Type component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.code component.valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedTerms/2.3216-.06 code.coding.code = 2.3216 code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements component.code.coding.code = 2.3216-.06 component.code.coding.display = Service Discharge Type component.code.coding.system = http://va.gov/terminology/vistaDefinedElements

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant enter 'Y' if s/he actually served in the Republic of Vietnam, 'N' if not, or 'U' if unknown. Once the service record has been verified only users who hold the designated security key may enter/edit this field.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Y' if this patient served in Vietnam, 'N' if not, 'U' if unknown.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32101 code.coding.display = "Vietnam Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32101 code.coding.display = "Vietnam Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant who served in the Republic of Vietnam (DID YOU SERVE IN VIETNAM prompt must be answered YES) enter the date on which service in vietnam commenced [between February 28, 1961 and May 7, 1975]. Once the service record is verified only users who hold the designated security key may enter/edit this field. As long as Vietnam service is indicated this date may not be deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date this patient commenced service in the Republic of Vietnam.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant who served in the Republic of Vietnam (DID YOU SERVE IN VIETNAM prompt must be answered YES) enter the date on which service in Vietnam ended [between February 28, 1961 and May 7, 1975]. Once the service record is verified only user who hold the designated security key may enter/edit this field. As long as Vietnam service is indicated this date may not be deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date this patient ended service in the Republic of Vietnam.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Did this patient serve in Lebanon between the dates of August 23, 1982 and February 26, 1984?
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Did this veteran serve in Lebanon during the conflict there?
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.3221 code.coding.display = "Lebanon Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.3221 code.coding.display = "Lebanon Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant who served in Lebanon, enter the date which the applicant's service in Lebanon began. The date must be on or after October 1, 1983. .
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE AFTER OCTOBER 1, 1983 TO INDICATE THE DATE THIS PATIENT BEGAN HIS SERVICE IN LEBANON

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this patient, enter the date the patient's service in Lebanon ended. The 'LEBANON SERVICE INDICATED?' field must be answered yes and the date in this field must be after October 1, 1983.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE AFTER OCTOBER 1, 1983 INDICATING THE DATE THIS PATIENT'S SERVICE IN LEBANON ENDED.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter yes if this patient served in Grenada between the dates of October 23, 1983 and November 21, 1983.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If this patient served during the conflict in Grenada, enter YES here. Enter NO if the patient did not serve in Grenada, or UNKNOWN if this can not be determined.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322 code.coding.display = "Grenada Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322 code.coding.display = "Grenada Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the date which this patient began service in Grenada. The 'GRENADA SERVICE INDICATED?' field must be answered YES and the date entered here must be between October 23, 1983 and November 21, 1983.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE BETWEEN 10/23/1983 AND 11/21/1983 INDICATING THE DATE THIS PATIENT'S SERVICE IN GRENADA BEGAN.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the date which this patient's service in Grenada ended. The 'GRENADA SERVICE INDICATED?' field must be yes and this date must be between October 23, 1983 and November 21, 1983.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE BETWEEN 10/23/1983 AND 11/21/1983 INDICATING THE DATE THE PATIENT'S SERVICE IN GRENADA ENDED.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Respond yes if this patient served in Panama between the dates of December 20, 1989 and January 31, 1990. Enter no if the patient did not serve in Panama during this timeframe. Otherwise, enter unknown if this information could not be obtained from the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Did this patient serve in the conflict in Panama? Answer YES, NO, or UNKNOWN.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.3227 code.coding.display = "Panama Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.3227 code.coding.display = "Panama Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served in Panama (PANAMA SERVICE INDICATED? is answered YES), enter the date this patient's service in Panama began. The date must be between December 20, 1989 and January 31, 1990.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE BETWEEN 12/20/1989 AND 1/31/1990 INDICATING THE DATE THIS PATIENT BEGAN SERVICE IN PANAMA.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served during the conflict in Panama (PANAMA SERVICE INDICATED? is YES), enter the date the patient's service there ended. The date must be between December 20, 1989 and January 31, 1990.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE BETWEEN 12/20/1989 AND 1/31/1990 INDICATING THE DATE THIS PATIENT'S SERVICE IN PANAMA ENDED.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served in the Persian Gulf during the war (anytime after August 2, 1990), enter yes here. If the patient did not serve in the Persian Gulf during this timeframe, enter no. Enter unknown if this information could not be obtained from the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Did this patient serve in the Persian Gulf War? Answer yes, no, or unknown.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32201 code.coding.display = "Persian Gulf Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32201 code.coding.display = "Persian Gulf Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served in the Persian Gulf during the war (PERSIAN GULF SERVICE? is answered YES), respond with the date the patient began serving there. The date must be on or after August 2, 1990.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A DATE BETWEEN 8/2/1990 AND TODAY INDICATING THE DATE THIS PATIENT BEGAN SERVING IN THE PERSIAN GULF.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served in the Persian Gulf during the war, enter the date the patient's service in that region ended. The date must be after the date selected as PERSIAN GULF FROM DATE which must be on or after August 2, 1990.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date this patient's service in the Persian Gulf ended. Date must either be null or in the past.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served in the Somalia, enter yes here. If the patient did not serve in Somalia, enter no. Enter unknown if this information could not be obtained from the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Did this patient serve in Somalia?
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322016 code.coding.display = "Somalia Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322016 code.coding.display = "Somalia Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this patient served in Somalia (SOMALIA SERVICE INDICATED? is answered YES), enter the date this patient's service in Somalia began. This date must be on or after September 28, 1992.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date veteran's service in Somalia began.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the last date of service in Somalia. This date must be on or after September 28, 1992.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date veteran's service in Somalia ended.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Field stores code indicating if patient served in the Yugolslavia Conflict.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Respond yes if patient served in the Kosovo Conflict (the airspace above and the adjacent waters of the Republic of Yugoslavia (Serbia/Montenegro), the Adriatic Sea & Ionian Sea n. of 39th parallel).
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322019 code.coding.display = "= Yugoslavia Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322019 code.coding.display = "= Yugoslavia Service" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the date that service in the Yugoslavia Conflict began for this patient. Earliest possible date is 6/22/1992.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a date between June 22, 1992 and today indicating the date this patient began serving in the Yugoslavia Conflict.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The date service in the Yugoslavia Conflict ended for this patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date this patient's service in the Yugoslavia Conflict ended. Date must be after June 22, 1992.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant enter 'Y' if s/he was exposed to the chemical agent orange, 'N' if not, or 'U' if unknown. Exposure cannot be claimed unless the Period of Service (field .323) is answered VIETNAM ERA, which entails those serving in the Korean DMZ between January 1, 1968 and December 31, 1969 or Vietnam. Once the service record has been verified only users who hold the designated security key may enter/edit this field.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Y' if this patient claims exposure to agent orange, 'N' if not, 'U' if unknown.
VistA_FHIR_Map.STU3Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32102 code.coding.display = Agent Orange Expos. Indicated code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final
VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32102 code.coding.display = Agent Orange Expos. Indicated code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For this veteran applicant who was exposed to agent orange (EXPOSED TO AGENT ORANGE prompt must be answered YES) enter the date registered. Once the service record is verified only users who hold the designated security key may enter/edit this field. As long as agent orange exposure is indicated this field may not be deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date on which this patient was registered as being exposed to agent orange.

Once the service record is verified only users who hold the designated security key may enter/edit this field. As long as agent orange exposure is indicated this field may not be deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date this patient was examined for the agent orange condition claimed.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter 'Y' if the veteran was exposed to ionizing radiation 1) at a nuclear device testing site (e.g. the Pacific Islands, NM or NV) or 2) as a POW or while serving in Hiroshima and/or Nagasaki, Japan from August 6, 1945 through July 1, 1946, or 3) served at Department of Energy plants at Paducah, KY, Portsmouth, OH or the K25 area at Oak Ridge, TN for at least 250 days before February 1, 1992 or 4) served at Longshot, Milrow, or Cannikin underground nuclear tests at Amchitka Island, AK prior to January 1, 1974. Veterans exposed by method #3 or #4 are not eligible for copay exemption or enrollment in priority 6 based on their IR exposure. Enter 'N' if not exposed or 'U' if unknown. Once the record has been verified only HEC users may enter/edit this field.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the RADIATION EXPOSURE INDICATED associated with the enrollment priority determination

VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.32103 code.coding.display = "Radiation Exposure Indicated" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter "Y" if veteran claims need for care of conditions related to service in SW Asia. Enter "N" if veteran did not serve in SW Asia or does not claim need for care of conditions related to service in SW Asia. Enter "U" when veteran served in SW Asia, but is unsure of whether conditions may be related to that service. SW Asia Theater of operations is defined as: Iraq, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, the neutral zone between Iraq and Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, Qatar, the United Arab Emirates, Oman, the Gulf of Aden, the Gulf of Oman, the Persian Gulf, the Arabian Sea, the Red Sea, and the airspace above these locations.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Y' if this patient claims exposure to Southwest Asia Conditions, 'N' if not, 'U' if unknown.

VistA_FHIR_Map.R4Map: valueCodeableConcept.coding.code valueCodeableConcept.coding.system = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0136 code.coding.code = 2-.322013 code.coding.display = "Southwest Asia Conditions" code.coding.system = http://va.gov/Terminology/VistaDefinedElements status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: DO NOT EDIT THIS FIELD. It is maintained by the Copay Exemption Software. This is the patients current Medication Copay Income Exemption Status. It is updated whenever an entry in the Billing Exemptions file is made. If a patient's income is less than the pension level, effective 10/29/92 the patient is exempt from paying the Medication Copayment. If a patient is receiving a VA Pension, or is receiving Aid and Attendence or House Bound benefits, or his income for the previous year is less than the pension level, he is exempt.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter whether this patient is currently exempt from pharmacy copay due to the income exemption.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the Health Benefit Plan that is assigned to a patient.
Choose from the available listing the name(s) of the insurance company(ies) under which this applicant is covered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the insurance company with which the patient has insurance coverage.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Choose from the available listing the name(s) of the insurance company(ies) under which this applicant is covered.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the Subscriber's Primary ID number. This number is assigned by the payer and can be found on the subscriber's insurance card. This field is scheduled for deletion in May 2015.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 3-20 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter any other appropriate number which identifies this policy, i.e., group number/code, under which this applicant is covered. Answer must be between 1 and 17 characters. This field is moved to the HEALTH INSURANCE POLICY file (355.3) beginning with IB v2.0. It will be deleted with the first release 18 months after the release of IB V2.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-17 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter 'v' if this insurance policy is held by the veteran (applicant), 's' if the veteran is married and the spouse holds the policy, or 'o' if someone other than the veteran or his/her spouse hold the policy, i.e., employer.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Example binding: use VA values, but mappings available to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/policyholder-relationship: 'v' FOR VETERAN; = self 's' FOR SPOUSE; = spouse 'o' FOR OTHER; = other

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the date that this insurance policy initially went into effect (the date the patient acquired this policy).
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 3-10 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this insurance policy under which this applicant is covered expires on a specified date enter that date, otherwise, leave this field blank.
Select from the available listing this applicant's current marital status.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Select from the available listing this patients current marital status.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: D DIVORCED: D (http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/MaritalStatus) M MARRIED: M (http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/MaritalStatus) N NEVER MARRIED: S (http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/MaritalStatus) S SEPARATED: L (http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/MaritalStatus) W WIDOWED: W (http://hl7.org/fhir)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Select from the available listing the religious preference of this applicant.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Select from the available list this patients religious preference.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Extensible: we can include VA codes but must include standard codes where applicable. Http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/patient-religion Use attached VistA-FHIR Religion map

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Patient's race
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-race

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Method used to collect patient's race
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the method in which the race value was collected
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: an extension on the US Core extension 1: SELF IDENTIFICATION 2: PROXY 3: OBSERVER 4: UNKNOWN

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-ethnicity

VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the method in which the ethnicity value was collected
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: an extension on the US Core extension 1: SELF IDENTIFICATION 2: PROXY 3: OBSERVER 4: UNKNOWN

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This multiple field contains the data relating to clinic enrollments for this patient.
This field will contain 'I' for inactive if this patient is no longer enrolled in this clinic (patient has been discharged from the clinic).
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If this patient is currently no longer enrolled in this clinic, enter 'I' here.

VistA_FHIR_Map.Field_x0020_Name: latest transaction date/time for transaction type=2
VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the internal entry number of the PATIENT MOVEMENT file denoting the most recent movement for an inpatient. This field is only stored for current inpatients. It must NOT be edited as this could affect the integrity of many options within MAS and other packages. When displaying this field, the date/time of the most recent movement will display.

If so desired, you may enter a short remark about this applicant between 3-60 characters. The remark entered should be significant and tact should be exercised since this field is viewable to virtually all other users who have the ability to 'call up' a patient for any purpose.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter remarks concerning this patient for general display [3-60 characters].

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is a reference number for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a whole number between 1 and 1000000000.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field should contain the prescribing physician's name.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: [Reference(Practitioner)]

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the route of administration for this medication. (If a corresponding abbreviation is found for this route in the MEDICATION ROUTES file, this package will print that abbreviation on it's reports.)
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter how this medication will be administered to the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Translate to standard if available

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This identifies the type of medication ordered.
This should contain a `1' (or `YES') if this medication is to be administered by the patient to himself.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a '1' (or 'YES') if this medication is to be self administered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Could use R4 performer but only on dispense

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This should contain a `1' (or `YES') if this medication is to be a `SELF MED' and this site's pharmacy is to supply the medication. This is only asked if the user enters `YES' (or `1') to the SELF MED prompt. If the SELF MED field is ever edited to show `NO' (or `0'), this is automatically deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' (or a '1') if this SELF MED is to be supplied by the medical center's pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 0' FOR NO; '1' FOR YES;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This describes the type of schedule for the dispensing of the medication(s) that make up the order. PRE-OP orders are usually considered to be ON-CALL orders, and orders dispensed as MUTLI-DOSE CONTAINERS are usually considered to be FILL ON REQUEST orders.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the code (C, O, OC, P, or R) corresponding to the scheduling of this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: O:ONE-TIME P:PRN C:CONTINUOUS R:FILL on REQUEST OC:ON CALL

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the status of the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: A:ACTIVE D:DISCONTINUED I:INCOMPLETE N:NON-VERIFIED U:UNRELEASED P:PENDING DE:DISCONTINUED (EDIT)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field will be used during the finishing process to determine if the user should be prompted whether they wish to finish the order as an IV or Unit Dose order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a 1 if the user should be prompted to finish this order as IV or Unit Dose.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Enter a 1 if the user should be prompted to finish this order as IV or Unit Dose.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date the medication was ordered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter Date/Time that order was written.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: same as login; ignored. Remove. 6/19. Replaced, 6/20

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the patient for which the medication has been ordered.
This is the date (to the second) the ordered was entered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the date (to the second) the ordered [sic] was entered.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the pointer value of the corresponding entry in the Orders file (100) when the order is entered through the OE/RR process.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-30 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the pointer value of the corresponding entry in the Orders file (100) when the order is entered through the OE/RR process. Do we need two systems for two identifiers: an OERR identifier & a Pharmacy identifier?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is used to show the method used to create this order.

This identifies the Orderable Item associated with the order. If the order contains multiple dispense drugs, or a single dispense drug requiring multiple units/dose, the Orderable Item and Dosage Ordered fields will be displayed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Medication to be taken If we need the medication resource, Binding: Medication Clinical Drug (RxNorm) (extensible)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the amount of the medication the patient is to receive as one dose for this order. This should be an amount with a unit of measure, such as '500mg' or '50CC'. THIS SHOULD NOT BE THE NUMBER OF TABLETS, ETC.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-60 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Parsed by VistA into 120, ,121

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the method the provider used to communicate the order to the user to enter (or take any other action on) the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the method the provider used to communicate the order to the service.
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: W:WRITTEN P:TELEPHONED V:VERBAL E:ELECTRONICALLY ENTERED I:POLICY S:SERVICE CORRECTION D:DUPLICATE

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the priority of the order that was received from OERR.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a priority for processing the order, if desired.
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: S:STAT A:ASAP R:ROUTINE P:PREOP T:TIMING CRITICAL D:DONE
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 'S' FOR STAT; => stat 'A' FOR ASAP; => asap 'R' FOR ROUTINE; => routine 'P' FOR PREOP; => do not send 'T' FOR TIMING CRITICAL; => do not send 'D' FOR DONE; => do not send

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the numeric dosage for the order. It will be combined with the UNIT field to show the dosage ordered. For a dosage of 325MG, 325 would be stored here.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between .0001 and 9999999999, 4 Decimal Digits
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the numeric dosage for the order. It will be combined with the UNIT field to show the dosage ordered. For a dosage of 325MG, 325 would be stored here.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the field which contains the unit for the numeric dosage. The combination of these two fields gives you the dosage ordered for this order. For a dosage of 325MG, MG would be stored here.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-75 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Use UCUM where possible. Get values; leverage KBS UCUM map.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the length of time to administer, or the total volume to administer, for IV fluid orders. The value may be in ML or CC for milliliters, L for liters, D for days, or H for hours.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-6 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: No need for extension: FHIR data type can handle both volume and time cases. Use a time or volume quantity in the numerator and "1" in the denominator.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the parent of a CPRS order that may have a parent/child relationship in CPRS
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the parent order, if this order is its child order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Yes; composite relationship to Parent. Direction in question: document parent or child, or both?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is any special instructions (using abbreviations whenever possible) needed for this order. This would include the physician's reason for ordering a PRN. The abbreviations and expansions from the MEDICATION INSTRUCTIONS file are utilized.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-180 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: For use by Pharmacy to print additional information on IV labels and reports.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-60 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the length of time in days the provider requests that this order last.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-40 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Don't use the MedicationOrder.dispenseRequest.validityPeriod: this is the wrong data type.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: <blank>
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-200 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the medication that will actually be dispensed for this order. An order may have more than one dispense drug.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a dispense drug for this order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the number of UNITS (tablets, capsules, etc.) to be dispensed as a DOSE for this order. The literals '1/2' and '1/4' may be entered. If there is no entry, it is assumed to be ONE (1). ** PLEASE NOTE ** If a doctor prescribes 30 ml's of a medication that is usually dispensed and administered as 60 ml's, the correct UNITS PER DOSE would be 1/2 (or .5), NOT 30 ml's. (30 ml's would be entered into the DOSAGE ORDERED field.) If the UNITS PER DOSE ordered is a variable amount (1-2 tab.), it is suggested that the maximum amount be entered into this field and the amount ordered noted either in the DOSAGE ORDERED or SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS fields.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a number between 0 and 30, no more than 4 decimals (will accept fractions).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is a separate instance of dosageInstruction

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the frequency (ONLY) with which the doses are to be administered. Several forms of entry are acceptable, such as Q6H, 09-12-15, STAT, QOD, and MO-WE-FR@AD (where MO-WE-FR are days of the week, and AD is the admin times). The schedule will show on the MAR, labels, etc. No more than TWO spaces (Q3H 4, TID PC PRN, or Q4H PRN) in the schedule are acceptable. If the letters PRN are found as part of the schedule, no admin times will print on the MAR or labels, and the PICK LIST will always show a count of zero (0). Avoid using notation such as W/F (with food) or WM (with meals)in the schedule as it may cause erroneous calculations. That information should be entered into the SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS. When using the MO-WE-FR@AD schedule, please remember that this type of schedule will not work properly without the "@" character and at least one admin time, and that at least the first two letters of each weekday entered is needed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-70 characters in length and may contain only two spaces.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the frequency (ONLY) with which the doses are to be administered. Several forms of entry are acceptable, such as Q6H, 09-12-15, STAT, QOD, and MO-WE-FR@AD (where MO-WE-FR are days of the week, and AD is the admin times). Thinigs not coded migh

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the order is to begin. This package initially assigns the START DATE/TIME to the closest administration time or next admin. time or NOW depends on the value of the DEFAULT START DATE CALCULATION field in the INPATIENT WARD PARAMETERS file. START DATE/TIME may not be entered prior to 7 days from the order's LOGIN DATE.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time that the first dose is to be given.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the date and time the order is to begin. "Enter the date and time that the first dose is to be given."

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the order will automatically expire. This package initially assigns a default STOP DATE/TIME, depending on the SITE PARAMETERS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time that the last dose is to be given (and the order will expire).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the date and time the order will automatically expire. This package initially assigns a default STOP DATE/TIME, depending on the SITE PARAMETERS.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the set of administration times for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a set of administration times for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: timeOfDay format hh:mm:ss; see http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#time

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is either a code or the number of minutes between the administration times for the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-6 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Date/Time the provider is requesting that this order start.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the requested Start Date/Time for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the Date/Time the provider is requesting that this order start.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the category of the order's IV TYPE. The IV TYPE CATEGORY will be "C" (Continuous) for orders with an IV TYPE of Admixture, Hyperal, Non-Intermittent Syringe, or Chemotherapy with a CHEMOTHERAPY TYPE of Admixture, Hyperal, or Non-Intermittent Syringe. The IV TYPE CATEGORY will be "I" (Intermittent) for orders with an IV TYPE of Piggyback, Intermittent Syringe, or Chemotherapy with a CHEMOTHERAPY TYPE of Piggyback or Intermittent Syringe.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: bind to IVMedicationScheduleCategory

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user who entered the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the user who entered the order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Type of IV - "A" for Admixture, "C" for Chemotherapy, "H" for Hyperal, "P" for Piggyback, and "S" for Syringe.

The rate at which the IV is to be administered. This value, together with the total volume of the hyperal or the admixture type, is used to determine the time covered by one bag; hence the system can predict the bags needed during a specified time of coverage. This field is free text for IVPB's. For LVP's you must enter a number representing the infusion rate. You may also specify the # of bags per day needed, which will become the default number of LABELS PER DAY. Example. 125 = 125 ml/hr (IV system will calculate bags needed per day) 125@2 = 125 ml/hr with 2 labels per day TITRATE@1 = TITRATE with 1 label per day. The format of this field is either a number only or [FREE TEXT@NUMBER OF LABELS PER DAY]. Note: If an administration time(s) is defined, the number of labels will reflect the administration time(s) for the IVPB type orders. For example: One administration time of 12:00 is specified. The infusion rate is entered as 125@3. Only 1 label will print.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-30 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment:
example: http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/medicationrequest0322.xml.html
If this is parseable, parse. Otherwise, ask: we'll need an extension.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: IV room where IV bag was prepared for administration.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: IV room where IV bag was prepared for administration.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The number of IV labels needed each day. If populated, this value will override the system-calculated number of labels.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a number between 0 and 99, 0 decimal digits.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The number of IV labels needed each day. If populated, this value will override the system-calculated number of labels.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The additive selected as part of the IV order. This entry is a pointer to the ADDITIVES file (52.6).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The additive selected as part of the IV order. This entry is a pointer to the ADDITIVES file (52.6).

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: "STRENGTH" is the amount of an additive to be used in the manufacturing of the IV order. NOTE! You will be expected to use the strength units that were previously defined within the IV ADDITIVE file (52.6) for each additive. For example, if the DRUG UNITS field of the IV ADDITIVES file specifies the units for ampicillin to be in grams, it would be incorrect to enter 500 for a half-gram dose. Enter 0.5 instead.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: "STRENGTH" is the amount of an additive to be used in the manufacturing of the IV order. NOTE! You will be expected to use the strength units that were previously defined within the IV ADDITIVE file (52.6) for each additive.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the bottle number (or numbers, separated by commas) in which this additive will be included for this IV order. If this field is blank, it means that the additive will be included in all bottles.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the bottle #'s that this additive will be in (e.g. '1', '1,3', or <return> for all bottles). In case of "See Comments," replace with specific bottle #'s or enter "@" to specify all bottles.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the bottle number (or numbers, separated by commas) in which this additive will be included for this IV order. If this field is blank, it means that the additive will be included in all bottles.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Entry must be a clinic. Depending on the condition, INACTIVATE and REACTIVATE dates may exist.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the name of the clinic where the patient was seen.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Enter the name of the clinic where the patient was seen. Entry must be a clinic. Depending on the condition, INACTIVATE and REACTIVATE dates may exist.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time of the appointment this order is being placed for.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: HELP-PROMPT: Date and time of the appointment for this clinic location. DESCRIPTION: This is the date and time of the appointment this order is being placed for. May be encounter at which order is created or for which created.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The solution entered as part of the specified IV order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The volume of this solution in MLs. Only numeric values may be entered in this field. The total volume of the IV order is sum of solution's volumes.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The volume of this solution in MLs. Only numeric values may be entered in this field. The total volume of the IV order is sum of solution's volumes.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field will contain the narrative portion of the OBX segment sent from OE/RR when an order check occurs.

VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-200 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is a medication that will actually be dispensed by pharmacy for this order. Each dispense drug of an order must be tied to the primary drug of the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a medication that will dispensed for this order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the number of UNITS (tablets, capsules, etc.) to be dispensed as a DOSE for this order. The literals '1/2' and '1/4' may be entered. If there is no entry, it is assumed to be ONE (1). ** PLEASE NOTE ** If a doctor prescribes 30 ml's of a medication that is usually dispensed and administered as 60 ml's, the correct UNITS PER DOSE would be 1/2 (or .5), NOT 30 ml's. (30 ml's would be entered into the DOSAGE ORDERED field.) If the UNITS PER DOSE ordered is a variable amount (1-2 tab.), it is suggested that the maximum amount be entered into this field and the amount ordered noted either in the DOSAGE ORDERED or SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS fields.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a number between 0 and 30, no more than 4 decimals (will accept fractions).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: because you can have multiple dispense drugs eg aspirin 1000 mg: 1 625 + 1 375

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date that this dispense drug will no longer be dispensed for this order. Once an order becomes active, dispense drugs cannot be deleted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date that this drug will no longer be dispense for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: this is prospective, not dateEnded

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is any special instructions (using abbreviations whenever possible) needed for this order. This would include the physician's reason for ordering a PRN. This field utilizes the abbreviations and expansions from the MEDICATION INSTRUCTIONS file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-180 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the frequency (ONLY) by which the doses are to be administered. Several forms of entry are acceptable, such as Q6H, 09-12-15, STAT, QOD, and MO-WE-FR@AD (where MO-WE-FR are days of the week, and AD is the admin times.) The schedule will show on the MAR, labels, etc. If the letters PRN are found as part of the schedule, no admin times will print on the MAR or labels, and the PICK LIST will always show a count of zero (0). Avoid using notation such as W/F (with food) or WM (with meals) in the schedule as it may cause erroneous calculations. That information should be entered into the SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS. When using the MO-WE-FR@AD schedule, please remember that this type of schedule will not work properly without the "@" character and at least one admin. time, and that at least the first two letters of each weekday entered is needed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-70 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Text representation of VistA content, which may be a standard string (treat as a code) or a parseable expression (codeableConcept.text)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the order is to begin. This package initially assigns the START DATE/TIME to the closest administration time or next admin. time or NOW depends on the value of the DEFAULT START DATE CALCULATION field in the INPATIENT WARD PARAMETERS. START DATE/TIME may not be entered prior to 7 days from the order's LOGIN DATE.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time that the first dose is to be given.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the order will automatically expire. This package initially calculates a default stop date, depending on the SITE PARAMETERS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date and time that the last dose is to be given (and the order will expire).

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the times of the day the medication is to be administered. This package initially assigns a default set of ADMIN TIMES when a STANDARD SCHEDULE is entered into the SCHEDULE prompt.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a set of times (1-119 characters) for the administration of this medication over a 24 hour period.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: timeOfDay format hh:mm:ss; see http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#time

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is either a code or the number of minutes between the times the medication is to be administered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-6 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is any remarks or explanations needed for this order.
