A syringe IV order may be continuous or intermittent. If a syringe type is continuous (not intermittent), the same order entry procedure will be followed as if a hyperal or admixture is being entered. If a syringe order is to be intermittent, the same order entry method as the piggback type will be followed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: if 0..*, must be on Order not Dispense bind to IVMedicationScheduleCategory

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Person who authorized the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: (Entry required.)
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: File #200-field 1 - name

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The rate at which the IV is to be administered. This value, together with the total volume of the hyperal or the admixture type, is used to determine the time covered by one bag; hence the system can predict the bags needed during a specified time of coverage. This field is free text for IVPB's. For LVP's you must enter a number representing the infusion rate. You may also specify the # of bags per day needed, which will become the default number of LABELS PER DAY. Example: 125 = 125 ml/hr (IV system will calculate bags needed per day) 125@2 = 125 ml/hr with 2 labels per day TITRATE@1 = TITRATE with 1 label per day The format of this field is either a number only or [FREE TEXT@NUMBER OF LABELS PER DAY]. Note: If an administration time(s) is defined, the number of labels will reflect the administration time(s) for the IVPB type orders. For example: One administration time of 12:00 is specified. The infusion rate is entered as 125@3. Only 1 label will print.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-30 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment:
example: http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/medicationrequest0322.xml.html
If this is parseable, parse. Otherwise, ask: we'll need an extension.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: You may enter a standard schedule here or non-standard schedule. If a standard schedule is entered, the doses will be given at the administration time(s). If a non-standard schedule is entered, and no administration times are entered, the doses will be given at time intervals past the start date/time of the IV order. TID = (09-17-21) doses will be given at admin. times. Q5H = (300 minutes) doses will be given every 300 minutes. The format of this field is [SCHEDULEspaceFREETEXTspaceFREETEXT] and 1-70 characters.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-70 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This will often be parseable from the content; if not, use codeableConcept.text

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the times that this order will be given separated by a '-'. The administration times have to be entered in ascending order. Each administration time must be at least two characters long or four characters long. Example: '03-07-11-15-19-23' or '0730-1130'. Administration times are REQUIRED for STANDARD schedules but are NOT REQUIRED for NON-STANDARD schedules.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-64 characters in length, e.g., 03-09-15-21.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: timeOfDay format hh:mm:ss; see http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#time

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the parent of an order that may have a parent/child relationship in CPRS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the parent, if this order is its child.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is not shown on the IV labels, but is shown on some of the IV reports.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-100 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pending comments etc.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the order was entered.
IV room where IV was prepared for administration.
This is used to show the method used to create this order. what actions may be taken on the order.
This is the ward where the patient was located when the order was created.
This field contains the pointer value for the person entered the IV order.

The duration of an order as requested by the ordering clinician in CPRS. The duration is stored as one of the following upper case letters followed by an integer: L - Months W - Weeks D - Days H - Hours M - Minutes S - Seconds Example: D6 = Six days.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 2-8 characters in length
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Either 55.01-151 or 55.01-152 may be present. L - Months = mo W - Weeks = wk D - Days = d H - Hours = h M - Minutes = min S - Seconds = s

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the length of time to administer, or the total volume to administer, for IV fluid orders. The value may be in ML or CC for milliliters, L for liters, D for days, or H for hours.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 2-7 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This will support volume or time in numerator: "1" in denominator

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is very similar to the REMARKS field except that OTHER INFO is shown on the label and the IV REPORTS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-60 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the pharmacist who verified the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the pharmacist who verified the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: activity= [assert new value: verify], or, agent.role="verifier"

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date/time the order was verified by the pharmacist.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date/time this order was verified by the pharmacist.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is an internal flag set whenever a pharmacist verifies the order.
This is an internal flag set whenever a nurse verifies the order.
The number of IV labels needed each day. If populated, this value will override the system-calculated number of labels.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a number between 0 and 99, 0 decimal digits.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Last time the prescription was filled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Should be accessible via query, but for now use literal

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Quantity of last filled prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a whole number between 0 and 999.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the additive which was selected as part of the IV order. This entry is a pointer to the ADDITIVES file (52.6).

'STRENGTH' is the amount of an additive that is used in the manufacturing of the IV order. NOTE! You'll be expected to use the strength units that have been previously defined within the additive file (52.6) for each additive. That is to say, if the additive file expects AMPICILLIN to be dispensed in 'GMS', it would not be correct for you to enter '500' for a half-gram dose -- enter 0.5 instead.

This is the bottle number (or numbers, separated by commas) in which this additive will be included for this IV order. If this field is blank, it means that the additive will be included in all bottles.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the bottle #'s that this additive will be in (e.g. '1', '1,3', or <return> for all bottles). In case of "See Comments," replace with specific bottle #'s or enter "@" to specify all bottles.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: <blank>
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: [reference to location]

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Date and time of the appointment for this clinic location.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This is the date and time of the appointment this order is being placed for.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the solution entered as part of the specified IV order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-120 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field represents the volume of this solution in MLs. Only a number can be entered into this field. The total volume of an IV ORDER is all the solution's volumes added together.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be a number from .01-9999.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is any comments about the order that the provider needs to pass along to the pharmacy and/or ward personnel.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pending comments

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date/time the order was renewed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the Date/Time this order was last renewed.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the name of the person who renewed this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the name of the person renewing this order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the name of the provider responsible for the prior order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the name of the provider for the order you renewed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: priorPrescription [Reference(MedicationOrder)]

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the stop date/time of the prior order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the Stop Date/Time of the previous order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: priorPrescription [Reference(MedicationOrder)]

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: When an order is being renewed, this is the pointer value of the corresponding entry in the ORDERS file (100), prior to the renewal.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-30 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: <blank>
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The Json is returning this data not sure the name of the extension.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains any special instructions or messages appropriate for this IV order. This field may only be edited when entering an order through the OE/RR package, and will only be displayed when viewing the order until the order has been verified.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-180 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The Json is returning this data not sure the name of the extension.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Log in IV activity.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a whole number between 1 and 999999999.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Tag will require concatenation with a string to clarify what it is, e.g., "NUMBER-" + [value]

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Captures type of activity. Enter one of following set of codes: H for hold, D for Discontinue, U for Unhold, E for Edit, R for Renew, I for Reinstate, AI for auto reinstate, O for On Call, C for Off call, V for Verify, F for Complete, PNRD for Pending/Non-Verified Renewal Discontinued, G for Flagged, or UG for Unflagged.
This is the free text name from the user file of the person who performed the activity on this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 2-30 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Reason for activity. This may be a message field.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 3-102 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Enter one of following set of codes: H for hold, D for Discontinue, U for Unhold, E for Edit, R for Renew, I for Reinstate, AI for auto reinstate, O for On Call, C for Off call, V for Verify, F for Complete, PNRD for Pending/Non-Verified Renewal Discontinued, G for Flagged, or UG for Unflagged.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date in which this action was taken.
This is the user who effected the activity.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This is the user who effected the activity.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: does "effected" mean "entered"?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the prescription number.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A WHOLE NUMBER BETWEEN 1 AND 999999999

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The patient receiving treatment.
This field is used to show the status of the patient at the time the medication was filled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: We don't drag along the whole Patient. We can use the _elements tag in the query to get only those of interest, but we hear it is not widely supported. In addition, since we are using a FHIR facade pattern (?), I'm not positive we can refer to specific versions of the patient to get the status at the time of dispense.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Doctor who wrote the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the name of a Provider.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Clinic where treatment was given and prescription was written.
The actual medication.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: changed from code to reference to support expiration

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Free Text that, if it exists, will replace the DRUG name on the RX label.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 1-32 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH, MUST NOT BE BLANK, AND CONTAIN AT LEAST ONE NON-NUMERIC CHARACTER.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to show the amount of medication that was dispensed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Pharmacy: Pills in the bottle

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter a whole number between 1 and 90. The maximum upper limit is 90, but may be lower based on the maximum specified for this patient status. This parameter is defined in the RX PATIENT STATUS file.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between 1 and 90, 0 Decimal Digits
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Could be in MedicationOrder

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The number of refills allowed per prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter number of refills for this RX, if refillable.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: The R2 FHIR description is ambiguous, though the R4 text is not, specifying "refills" exclusive of first fill. This is the VistA meaning: for 3 fills total, including the first, "refills" would be 2.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The number of copies made of the label for the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between 1 and 99, 0 Decimal Digits

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Indicates if the medication will be picked up or mailed to the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: coordinate with 55-.03

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Any additional comments.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 1-75 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field will show who requested the rx.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the name of the person who requested the medication.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Data entry: usually same as Provider but not necessarily

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Date when doctor wrote prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: "Can be edited to manage expiry? Keep 'issuedate' nmae"

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The date the prescription was entered.
The date the prescription was filled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: finish or hand over?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to identify the pharmacist that filled the medication request.
The date the medication expires. This is required to be put on the labels of medication sent to a nursing home.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This date is the date on which the prescription is no longer fillable.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to show the actual date and time the medication was released for inventory purposes and copay billing if applicable.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date/time the medication was released.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field indicates whether or not the patient received counseling about the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If patient was counseled about this Rx enter Yes.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field indicates whether or not the patient understood the counseling on the prescription, if the patient was counseled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: If patient understood counseling received enter 'Yes'.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Tells which Outpatient Pharmacy Division filled the prescription.
This field is used to show when and if the medication was returned to stock because the patient did not pick up the meds or it was not mailed.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter date/time when and if medication was returned to inventory due to not being picked up or mailed to the patient.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field identifies the cosigning physician for prescriptions written by a provider for whom a counter signature is required, for example a nurse practitioner.
This field contains the last fill date.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter date that he presciption was last filled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Recommend client simply sort Dispense by date.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to show the pharmacist that verified the prescription
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter name of pharmacist that is verifing the prescription.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The text in this field shall be used for the Patient Instructions in the Outpatient Pharmacy package when entering orders, if the Dispense Drug selected is matched to a Pharmacy Orderable Item with patient instructions.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter patient instructions. Answer must be 1-240 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter any special instructions that should appear on mailing address portion of the label, specifing where, or when the RX(s) should be picked up.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 2-60 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the medication being prescribed is for a service connected condition. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is for a Service Connected condition.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is a single dose of medication the patient will receive for this Rx order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-80 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: this is the dose subfile identifier/pointer

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the number of Units (tablets, capsules, etc.) to be dispensed as a dose for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between 0 and 99999999, 2 Decimal Digits
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This could be recorded as a separate Doseage with units = 1 {tablet} and dose = count. You might get a dosage in mg and a dosage in tablets in one order, but only if they are two different sequences, connected by a conjunction. So it can go in the same FHIR target.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Unit of measure. Pointer to the Drug Units file (50.607).
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the unit associated with dosage ordered.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: These are the nouns that are associated with this Dosage form. It will be used by the Outpatient Pharmacy software to build a SIG for an OE/RR order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-30 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the length of time that a medication order should be given. If you enter a numeric value, Days will be assumed. You may also enter a numeric value followed by a letter. The letters can be entered as 'M' for Minutes, 'H' for Hours, 'D' for Days, 'W' for Weeks, 'L' for Months. THIS IS NOT DAYS SUPPLY!
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This is the length of time a medication should be given. Enter a numeric value followed by a 'M' for Minutes, 'H' for Hours, 'D' for Days, 'W' for Weeks, 'L' for Months. THIS IS NOT DAYS SUPPLY!
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 'M' for Minutes - min 'H' for Hours - h 'D' for Days - d 'W' for Weeks - wk 'L' for Months - mo

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This code is used to help build a Possible Sig for a complex medication dose. This code usually expands to an "and", a "then", or an "except".
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: A code should only be entered if a complex order is being entered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: For conjunct sigs, each doseageInstruction also requires a serial number to allow the batch to be parsed in order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is how the medication is taken, applied, or used.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter how medication is to be administered.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to tell the patient how often the medication is to be used.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-20 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This verb will be used to describe how the medication will be taken/used.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-20 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is a single dose of medication the patient will receive for this Rx order. Data should be entered into the field when the patient has another language preference and there is a free-text of a local dosage entered.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-80 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field stores any provider comments that are passed to Pharmacy from CPRS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: changed. Order note is from the provider.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to distinguish what type of external discontinue action occurred.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Data should not be entered directly with FileMan.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 1' FOR HOSPITAL ADMISSION; '2' FOR EDITED BY PROVIDER;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Pharmacy Orderable Item associated with the drug. This data should not be entered by using File Manager. If the Rx does not have a Pharmacy Orderable Item entered check the drug for the RX. If the drug is missing an orderable item match the drug not the Rx. Only matching the Rx will cause problems when renewing the Rx.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: This data should not be entered by using File Manager.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the item from the clinical order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the CPRS entry number for this order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between 1 and 9999999999, 0 Decimal Digits

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to indicate the person who finished the order in Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Data not entered directly with FM.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Date/time prescription is finished.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: (No range limit on date)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The name of the pharmacist who scanned the barcode before filling the medication request.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Data not entered directly with FM.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The name of the pharmacist that checked the medication request.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Data not entered directly with FM.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This holds a Sig from OERR.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-200 characters in length.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Expanded, readable format of 52.0113 information

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field represents the current status of the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: ACTIVE; = active NON-VERIFIED; = draft EXPIRED; = completed HOLD; = active DRUG INTERACTIONS; = draft SUSPENDED; = active DELETED; = entered-in-error FOR PROVIDER HOLD; = active DISCONTINUED (all 3) = stopped

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the internal entry number of the pointer to the IB Action Type file (#350.1).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: RR - Need this for '$' indicator

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Titration Dose Rx from which the corresponding Maintenance Dose Rx originated.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the corresponding titration dose prescription number.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine the Titrationm indictor (TITRX^PSOUTL)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Maintenance Dose Rx that was created from the corresponding Titration Dose Rx.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the corresponding maintenance dose prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine the Titrationm indictor (TITRX^PSOUTL)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This flag indicates whether the prescription is being dispensed as a Titration Dose. It is intended to identify a Titration Dose Rx without a corresponding Maintenance Dose Rx.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Indicate if the prescription is a Titration Dose Prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine the Titrationm indictor (TITRX^PSOUTL)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This date is used to indicate when the medication was cancelled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the date this medication is no longer active for dispensing.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine recently disontinued and expired list R4 does not use this property: it may become an extension then.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Dispensed As Written code. This information is used for electronic claim transmission to third party payers (insurance companies).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is a record of dispense, not an instruction

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been treated for Military Sexual Trauma, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition related to Military Sexual Trauma. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used for treatment of Military Sexual Trauma.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to Agent Orange during Vietnam service, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used for treatment of Vietnam-Era herbicide exposure.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: this is not necessarily 'reason': the indication may be "due to" this exposure, but the exposure is not (necessarily) the (0..1) 'reason' for the prescription.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to ionizing radiation during military service, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used to treat a condition due to ionizing radiation exposure during military service.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to Southwest Asia Conditions (formerly referred to as Environmental Contaminants), the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used to treat a condition related to service in Southwest Asia.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been treated for Head and/or Neck Cancer due to nose or throat radium treatments while in the military, the pharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat this condition. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used to treat Head and/or Neck Cancer due to nose or throat radium treatments while in the military.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the medication being prescribed is for a condition related to Combat Services while in the military. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used to treat a condition related to Combat Services.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the medication being prescribed is for a condition related to PROJ 112/SHAD while in the military. This field will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a default should this question be raised again during the life of the prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used to treat a condition related to PROJ 112/SHAD

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date the prescription is refilled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter Date of refill

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains 'M' if the refill is to be mailed to the patient and 'W' if the refill is to be picked up at the pharmacy window.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: M' FOR MAIL; 'W' FOR WINDOW;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the Pharmacy Division associated with this Rx.

TECHNICAL DESCR: This field allows numeric entries only, both for CMOP prescriptions and non-CMOP prescriptions. It requires a number between .01 and 99999999, with a maximum of 2 fractional decimal places. NOTE: QTY values that were on file prior to patch PSO*7*29 (released 2/17/00) may contain alpha characters.
This field is used to show days of supply of refill.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between 1 and 90, 0 Decimal Digits

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the name of the pharmacist responsible for this Rx.

This field contains the internal number of the order from the ORDER file (#100), representing the corresponding Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS) order to this pending Outpatient Pharmacy order. This field also acts as a temporary holding place for any external system order number, for orders received from any external system. An external system order number will only be stored here temporarily, until the CPRS order number is received to replace the external system order number.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During CPRS order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been treated for Military Sexual Trauma, the clinician will be asked to identify whether or not the outpatient medication order being prescribed is being used to treat a condition related to Military Sexual Trauma. This field will store the response that was entered for this question. This value will be used as the default value for the same prompt presented to the pharmacist when finishing the medication order that was entered through CPRS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: 'Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used for treatment of Military Sexual Trauma.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: During CPRS order entry, if a veteran has been identified as having been exposed to Agent Orange during Vietnam service, the clinician will be asked to identify whether or not the outpatient medication order prescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. This field will store the response that was entered for this question. This value will be used as the default value for the same prompt presented to the pharmacist when finishing the medication order that was entered through CPRS.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter 'Yes' if this prescription is being used to treat a condition due to Agent Orange exposure during Vietnam service.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is free text, but contains the codes of the DHCP packages that consider this drug part of its formulary. This field is set through the routine ^PSGIU, and NOT through VA FileMan. NOTES: Uneditable through VA FileMan.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Enter the date the drug became inactive.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to show the DEA Special Handling .
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 1-6 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH
VistA_FHIR_Map.values: THE SPECIAL HANDLING CODE IS A 2 TO 6 POSTION FIELD. IF APPLICABLE, A SCHEDULE CODE MUST APPEAR IN THE FIRST POSITION. FOR EXAMPLE, A SCHEDULE 3 NARCOTIC WILL BE CODED '3A', A SCHEDULE 3 NON-NARCOTIC WILL BE CODED '3C' AND A SCHEDULE 2 DEPRESSANT WILL BE CODED '2L'. THE CODES ARE: 0 MANUFACTURED IN PHARMACY 1 SCHEDULE 1 ITEM 2 SCHEDULE 2 ITEM 3 SCHEDULE 3 ITEM 4 SCHEDULE 4 ITEM 5 SCHEDULE 5 ITEM 6 LEGEND ITEM 9 OVER-THE-COUNTER L DEPRESSANTS AND STIMULANTS A NARCOTICS AND ALCOHOLS P DATED DRUGS I INVESTIGATIONAL DRUGS M BULK COMPOUND ITEMS C CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES - NON NARCOTIC R RESTRICTED ITEMS S SUPPLY ITEMS B ALLOW REFILL (SCH. 3, 4, 5 ONLY) W NOT RENEWABLE F NON REFILLABLE E ELECTRONICALLY BILLABLE N NUTRITIONAL SUPPLEMENT U SENSITIVE DRUG

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the internal record number of the drug.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: TYPE A WHOLE NUMBER BETWEEN 1 AND 99999
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: system = VAMC medication list

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the VA classification for this drug.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter the VA Classification.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Indicates if this drug may be dispensed from the Consolidated Mail Outpatient Pharmacy System.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 1 (yes) or 0 for whether CMOP dispense is permitted. Not returned, used with CMOP api on 52 tab/Part of CMOP Property (52) Need the "AQ" cross reference on this field as an extention as part of the CMOP Indicator Logic.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field should contain the print name of the 'GENERIC DRUG' (file #50). The print name entered here will be printed on the IV label, Ward list, Manufacturing list etc. It should not contain strength, since strength is entered with each individual IV order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Name must be 3-30 characters, not numeric or starting with punctuation.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field should contain the print name of the solution. The name that is entered here will be printed on the IV label, manufacturing list, ward list, etc. The volume should NOT be part of the print name, since the volume of the IV ORDER will be printed next to the print name.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 3-30 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Federal Schedule for controlled substances.
This is the VA Print Name.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Answer must be 1-40 characters in length.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field will designate the formulary status of the orderable item. The non-formulary status will be displayed to the provider next to the selectable list of orderable item(s) during CPRS order entry (List Manager and GUI). This field is not editable. It is controlled by the software. An Orderable Item will only be marked as non-formulary if there are no active Dispense Drugs matched to the item that are formulary drugs.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Enter a '1' if this orderable item is not on the formulary list.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Currenlty 1 for 'not formulary'. Use code to support future discrimination of kinds of formulary.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to indicate whether or not the Orderable Item is a supply, 1 indicating a supply.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Currenlty 1 for supply. Use code to support future discrimination of kinds of supply, device, etc.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date/time the specimen was taken.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ENTER DRAW TIME OR VERIFY TIME

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Also: for chem labs, status = final

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the specimen type.
This is the accession for this specimen.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 1-20 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the person requesting the test.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Use ProcedureRequest; use Practitioner R4 use ServiceRequest; use Practitioner

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Default test heading for cumulative results reports. (May be different in LAB REPORTS file 64.5.) in LAB REPORTS file 64.5)
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 1-20 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: We may also need to put this value in result.code.text (Observation)
DATA GETS SET IN SPECIFIC NODE i.E. ^LR(D0,CH,D1,N) where N is a specific number designated for a lab value.

Source unclear; calculated? IF OUTSIDE OF REF RANGE (HIGH OR LOW) VistA H = HL7 H, High, system = http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/0078 VistA H* = HL7 HH, Critically high VistA L = HL7 L, Low VistA L* = HL7 LL, Critically Low This appears to be coming from VistA functionality, not file 63

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: UNITS represents such things as grams, number of items per cubic millimeter, or microliter.
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 2-10 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: To do: get allowed values & map to UCUM

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user entered reference low value for this test. If both the low and high are defined it will print in this manner: low : 10 high : 50 If only the low is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: low: 10 If only the low is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: NORMAL If only the high is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: high: 50 If only the high is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: >1000
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 0-50 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH (USE "QUOTES" AROUND TEXT)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user entered reference high value for this test. If both the low and high are defined it will print in this manner: low : 10 high : 50 If only the low is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: low: 10 If only the low is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: NORMAL If only the high is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: high: 50 If only the high is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: >1000
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 0-50 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH (USE "QUOTES" AROUND TEXT)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user entered critical low value for this test. Used to flag results. If both the low and high are defined it will print in this manner: low : 10 high : 50 If only the low is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: low: 10 If only the low is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: NORMAL If only the high is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: high: 50 If only the high is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: >1000
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 0-50 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH (USE "QUOTES" AROUND TEXT)
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: May not need info provided through flag with a "*"

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user entered critical high value of this test. Used to flag results. If both the low and high are defined it will print in this manner: low : 10 high : 50 If only the low is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: low: 10 If only the low is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: NORMAL If only the high is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: high: 50 If only the high is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: >1000
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 0-50 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH (USE "QUOTES" AROUND TEXT)

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Reviewed by Jay 7/2 - if more than author required then use richAnnotation extension provided by Jay, otherwise use Observation.comment
Reviewed by Jay 7/2 - if more than author required then use richAnnotation extension provided by Jay, otherwise use Observation.comment

VistA_FHIR_Map.values: 1:FEVER 2:IRRITABILITY 3:LOCAL REACTION OR SWELLING 4:VOMITING 5:RASH OR ITCHING 6:LETHARGY 7:CONVULSIONS 8:ARTHRITIS OR ARTHRALGIAS 9:ANAPHYLAXIS OR COLLAPSE 10:RESPIRATORY DISTRESS 11:OTHER 0:NONE

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The additive selected as part of the IV order. This entry is a pointer to the ADDITIVES file (52.6).

use Location

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If the IV is not a outpatient IV, this field will be a pointer to the ward file 42. If the IV is a outpatient IV, this field will contain a .5
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: Type a Number between 0 and 999, 1 Decimal Digit.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the ward where the patient was located when the order was created.

'STRENGTH' is the amount of an additive that is used in the manufacturing of the IV order. NOTE! You'll be expected to use the strength units that have been previously defined within the additive file (52.6) for each additive. That is to say, if the additive file expects AMPICILLIN to be dispensed in 'GMS', it would not be correct for you to enter '500' for a half-gram dose -- enter 0.5 instead.
Date and time of the appointment for this clinic location.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user entered reference low value for this test. If both the low and high are defined it will print in this manner: low : 10 high : 50 If only the low is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: low: 10 If only the low is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: NORMAL If only the high is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: high: 50 If only the high is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: >1000
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 0-50 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH (USE "QUOTES" AROUND TEXT)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the user entered reference high value for this test. If both the low and high are defined it will print in this manner: low : 10 high : 50 If only the low is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: low: 10 If only the low is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: NORMAL If only the high is defined and it is numeric it will print in this manner: high: 50 If only the high is defined and it is alphanumeric it will print in this manner: >1000
VistA_FHIR_Map.prompt: ANSWER MUST BE 0-50 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH (USE "QUOTES" AROUND TEXT)
